title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It modifies the calculation of retired pay for qualified retirees under chapter 61, subject to reductions based on years of creditable service. Amendments include clerical changes to section headings and table of sections. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Amendments to section 1413a(f) and the effective date of the changes are specified. Combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The reduction in payment under paragraph (1) for any month is based on the member's retired pay exceeding a certain percentage of their years of creditable service multiplied by their retired pay base. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act and applies to payments starting from that date.
